Integra® Jarit®
Limit uncertainty by protecting 
your instrument investmentSterilization Containers2
Integra® Jarit® 
Sterilization Containers
Summary of Integra Sterilization Container Product Features 
Gaskets within retention plates and container 
perimeter help ensure a secure seal of the 
container, lid and filter.Snap on filter plate with 
a locking mechanism for 
changing disposable filters
Round disposable filters with centering 
hole to assist in proper alignment.
4 ID T ag Windows  
(2 front & 2 back)
Low profile latch securely 
closes lid over container 
bottom.
Fold-down handles 
extend and stop at 90º 
to aid lifting.T amper Evident Lock –  
helps identify sterility breach.
2 Indicator Card Windows 
(1 front & 1 back). Indicator 
card has visible bar for 
clear indication that steam 
sterilization has been achieved.Corner design 
allows for same size 
container stacking  
in storage.Lid and Bottom 
manufactured using 
anodized aluminum alloy.  
Easy to maintain, corrosion 
resistant, lightweight yet 
durable, and conducts heat 
for material drying period.ID tags available in 
6 colors and can 
be engraved with 
up to 18 characters 
per line.
Note: Baskets are constructed with solid wire mesh to allow ultrasonic cleaning; handles can be positioned to assist with a secure grasp for removal under sterile conditions.3

Carb-Bite ™  Jarit Supercut ™
Carb-Edge ™ P .e.e.r ™
Cardio-Grip ™ Roto-Cam ™
Jarit Articulator ™ Roto-Lok ™
Jarit Rotator ™ Tip-It  ™Guarantee/Warranty
Integra ™ Jarit® Instruments are guaranteed against defects in material and 
workmanship. Integra will, at its option and without charge, either repair or replace 
any instrument which Integra determines to be defective in material or workmanship 
when used for its intended surgical purpose.  
 
All Jarit instruments sold by Integra are warranted only to the original purchaser and 
only against defects in workmanship or materials which under the intended use 
render such instruments inoperable.  
 
All Jarit® Carb-Bite ™ and Jarit Carb-Edge ™ instruments are further warranted for a 
period of three (3) years under normal use. Should any adjustment become necessary 
during this warranty period, Carb-Edge Scissors will be resharpened, and Carb-Bite 
Needle Holder jaw inserts will be replaced, without charge.  
 
All Jarit Supercut ™ Scissors are further warranted for a period of one year under 
normal use. Should any resharpening become necessary during this warranty period, 
Jarit will provide this service without charge. A nominal charge will be made for 
sharpening a/fter expiration of this warranty.  
 
This Guarantee/Warranty shall be void in the event any JARIT® instrument is used for 
purposes other than as originally intended, is not maintained or cleaned properly, is 
damaged as a result of misuse or accident, or is repaired or altered by unauthorized 
persons. 
 
The above is a limited warranty, and it is the only warranty made by Integra for 
Jarit® Instruments. Integra makes no other warranty, express or implied, including 
any warranty of merchantability and ﬁtness for a particular purpose, as well as 
any express or implied warranty to patients. Integra shall have no liability for 
consequential, exemplary or incidental damages even if it is aware of the possibility 
of such damages. No warranty or guarantee may be created by any act or statement 
nor may this warranty be modiﬁed in any way, except as a result of a writing signed 
by an oﬃcer of Integra. These limitations on the creation or modiﬁcation of this 
warranty may not be waived or modiﬁed orally or by any conduct. The stated express 
warranty is in lieu of all liabilities or obligations of Integra arising out of, or in 
connection with, the delivery, use or performance of any Integra instrument. Integra 
neither assumes nor authorizes any representative or other person to assume for it 
any other liability in connection with Jarit Instruments.
Ordering Procedure
A wri/tten purchase order on customer's form may be requested for purchase of 
Integra products. 
Acceptance of Order
Orders are accepted upon approval by Integra. 
Returned Goods Policy
Products must be returned in unopened packages with manufacturer’s seals intact to 
be accepted for replacement or credit unless returned due to a complaint of product 
defect. Determination of a product defect will be made by Integra. Products will not 
be accepted for replacement if they have been in the possession of the customer for 
more than 90 days.
Repairs and Maintenance
Should your instruments require repair or maintenance, contact Integra for return 
authorization and address. Instruments returned to Integra for repair must have a 
statement testifying that each instrument has been thoroughly cleaned and sterilized. 
Failure to supply evidence of cleaning and disinfection will result in a cleaning charge 
and delayed processing of your instrument repair.
Product Information Disclosure
Integra and its subsidiaries ("Integra") and manufacturer exclude all warranties, 
except Integra's applicable standard warranty whether expressed or implied, 
including but not limited to, any implied warranties of merchantability or ﬁtness 
for a particular purpose. Neither Integra nor manufacturer shall be liable for any 
incidental or consequential loss, damage, or expense, directly or indirectly arising 
from use of these products. Neither Integra nor manufacturer assume nor authorize 
any person to assume for them any other or additional liability or responsibility in 
connection with these products.©2011 Integra LifeSciences Corporation.

36877-468-5572 USA        800-275-7192 fax        integralife.com  General Operating Instruments    Q   Carb-Edge Scissors
Carb-Edge ™ Scissors
These superbly cra9fted instruments have a hard tough alloy permanently welded to the scissors and are 
vacuum hardened. This alloy, composed principally of tungsten, cobalt, chromium and carbon, is harder 
than stainless steel. Cu9tting edges of Carb-Edge Scissors are manufactured to ensure instrument durability 
and longer-lasting blade edge sharpness.
Carb-Edge Scissors are warranted to stay sharp for at least three years of normal usage.  
If sharpening should be required during the warranty period, it will be done without charge.  
Finger rings are gold plated for easy identiﬁcation.General Operating Instruments
37

Developed by utilizing unique and innovative methods of grinding, sharpening and heat treating, Jarit 
Supercut™ scissors have a degree of sharpness greater than on conventional surgical scissors. Finger rings 
are black plated for easy identiﬁcation.
All Jarit Supercut Scissors are further warranted for a period of one year under normal usage. Jarit Supercut 
Scissors will be date stamped for control.
The Jarit Supercut blade 
is razor sharp and glides 
eﬀortlessly through tissue 
with a clean cut. The ﬁnely 
serrated lower blade helps 
prevent slippage.INCHES

877-468-5572 USA        800-275-7192 fax        integralife.com  General Operating Instruments    Q   Carb-Bite Needle Holders
Carb-Bite ™ Needle Holders
Jarit Carb-Bite Needle Holders feature jaw inserts of solid tungsten carbide. Sharply deﬁned serrations have 
been milled into these inserts to provide a secure hold on the suture needle.
Because tungsten carbide is harder than stainless steel, the useful life of Carb-Bite Needle Holders exceeds 
that of ordinary needle holders. Jarit Carb-Bite Needle Holders are warranted for a minimum of three years 
of normal usage. If jaw serrations should wear smooth while under warranty, new Carb-Bite inserts will be 
installed without charge. Finger rings are gold plated for easy identiﬁcation.INCHES

192877-468-5572 USA        800-275-7192 fax        integralife.com  General Operating Instruments    Q   Self-Retaining Retractors
The Seton Shallow Surgical Retractor is a four sided stainless steel surgical retractor developed to aid the 
surgeon during shallow or superﬁcial surgery with the use of a combination of diﬀerent retractor blades, 
toothed or cupped.

Introduction:
Jarit added hundreds of new cardiovascular instruments 
into an already extensive line of cardiovascular and thoracic 
instruments. The Jarit® line is now a comprehensive oﬀering 
of high quality, precision instruments that meet the general 
and speciﬁc clinical needs of almost any cardiothoracic or 
vascular surgeon. We now oﬀer a complete line of specially 
cra7fted instruments from delicate, atraumatic clamps and 
micro needle holders to the demanding bone cu7tting forceps 
and rib spreaders. Each instrument is made with high grade 
surgical stainless steel with exacting standards which 
provide the right "feel" surgeons demand.INCHES

Standard French Gauge
The standard French is used to measure diameters of all bougies,
catheters, sounds, suction tubes and uterine dilators.

832877-468-5572 USA        800-275-7192 fax        integralife.com  Suture Guide & Conversion T ables    Q   CV Dimensions
How to Measure a Cardiovascular Instrument
Jaw Dimensions
A=Overall length is measured in a straight line from the bo/ttom of the ring handles to the farthest tip  
(see below)
B=Jaw working length is measured in a straight line from the tip of the clamp to the end of the serrations
C=Jaw depth, on an occlusion clamp is measured by drawing a straight line from the jaw tip to the end of  
the serrations, then ﬁnding the approximate center of the jaw and measure to the inside of the jaw
Length
Overall length is measured in a 
straight line from the bo/ttom of 
the ring handles to the farthest 
tip (see above)Length
Curved and angled instruments, 
the length is determined by a line 
drawn from the bo/ttom of the 
instrument to the farthest point 
(see above)Suture Guide & Conversion T ables
833
877-468-5572 USA        800-275-7192 fax        integralife.com  
Vascular Jaw Conﬁgurations
DeBakey Atraugrip Jaws 1 x 2 T eeth (Fig 1)
The most commonly used jaw design. Available in three sizes, Standard, Small and extra small. A single row 
of serrated teeth opposing a double row. Proven throughout the world for adult peripheral vascular, aortic 
occlusion, partial occlusion, bulldogs, pediatric clamps and vascular tissue forceps.
DeBakey Atraugrip Jaws 2 x 3 T eeth (Fig 2)
A double row of serrated teeth opposing a triple row. A broader clamping surface for aortic cross clamping 
on diseased and calciﬁed arteries. Clamps with 2 x 3 serrations are also used frequently in general surgery as 
bowel clamps.
Cooley T ype T eeth, 2 x 2 T eeth (Fig 3)
T wo opposing rows of ﬁne atraumatic teeth. Designed for infants and children. The jaws grasp vessels ﬁrmly 
with less danger of crushing. Available on a limited group of adult vascular clamps.
(Fig 1)
(Fig 2)
(Fig 3)Suture Guide & Conversion T ables    Q   Vascular Jaw ConfigurationsINCHES

 tracking capabilities
wT raceability of items to the patient level
wEmployee productivity and educational statistics
wStandard and custom reports availableConsulting Services:
Physical Inventory
We will perform a physical inventory of your surgical 
instruments, trays, and equipment, etc., as deemed necessary 
to assure accurate data at time of installation.
Database Build
Following the inventory, the data is reviewed by our 
consultants and entered into your new instrument database.
Implementation Services
We will provide software training to customer personnel over 
the course of several pre-determined visits to cover all aspects 
of software use and management.
Instrument Expansion/Conversion Product Support
&41:@13>-@1-9C588.1-B-58-.81@;2-/585@51?:1105:3  
assistance with instrument expansion/conversion projects 
such as physical inventories, set utilization, needs assessments 
-:0<>;/1??28;C?@A051?&41:@13>-@1-9C588<>;B501  
the additional support required to develop standardized 
trays, process orders, receive/unpack shipments and 
prepare new trays.

where instrument cleaning isnotimmediately available.

53
_ Carb •..N·Sert Scissors
OUR TOP QUALITY LINE OFSURGICAL SCISSORS
Manufactured totraditionally highMiltex standards, these tungsten carbide
blades arebonded tothefinest quality stainless steelsurgical scissors, then
precision ground andhoned ondiamond wheels.
oPrecision screws, fullytempered,
willkeepthese scissors inperfect
alignment.
oScissors shanks aretempered toa
hardness thatpermits proper flexibility.
oFinger ringsarewellrounded and
polished forbetter 'feel" andprevention
offinger fatigue, andeach instrument
issatinfinished toreduce glare.
Goldplated finger rings identify these tungsten carbide instruments, andthe
Miltex catalog number hasbeen etched oneach scissors tofacilitate
re-ordering.
Carb-N-Sert Scissors willrarely require sharpening. While theinitial costof
Carb-N-Sert Scissors ishigher thanstandard stainless scissors, Carb-N-Sert
Scissors represent aconsiderable savings totheuserinthelongrunbecause
ofsuperior performance andlonger service life.
54-
5·6TCCARB-N-SERT SCISSORS
withtungsten carbide insert blades willstaysharp foryears
l
5·16TC 5·26TC 5·36TC 5·46TC

_SuperCut Scissors

5·SC·16 5·SC·46 S-SC·120
S-SC·124
Manufactured withthehighest quality stainless steeiandGerman craftsmanship,
Miitex SuperCut Scissors areidealforvarious surgical anddental procedures or
applications. SuperCut Scissors haveaspecially designed razor-sharp upper
blade edgethatcutseffortlessiy through tissue. Thelower blade hasmicro-fine
serrations toprevent tissue slippage. Foreasyidentification, Miltex SuperCut
Scissors havetwoblack finger rings.
Miltex alsooffers SuperCuUCarb-N-Sert" Scissors, which haveprecision
SuperCut performance withonelower serrated blade andoneupper razor-sharp
blade, aswellasthedurability ofTungsten Carbide cutting edges, These
scissors areeasily identified withoneshortandonelonggold-plated finger ring,

_Carb=N=Sert NeedleHolders
- OURTOPQUALITY LINEOFNEEDLE HOLDERS
Carb-N-Sert jawsaremade of
tungsten carbide, thehardest steel
made forsurgical instruments. They
arethenbonded toneedle holders
made ofthefinest quality stainless
steel.accidental cutting ofsuture material
when heldinthejaws.
Theedges around theboxlock
havedistinct non-catch bevels,
preventing fraying ofsuture
material.
Teeth areprecision milled intothe
tungsten carbide, forming sharp
pyramid-shapes toprovide a
positive non-slip griponneedles
andsutures.Finger Rings arewellrounded and
polished forbetter "feel" and
prevention offinger fatigue.
Each instrument issatinfinished to
reduce glare.
Goldplated finger ringsidentify these
tungsten carbide instruments, andthe
Miltex catalog number hasbeen
etched oneach needle holder to
facilitate re-ordering.
Carb-N-Sert Needle Holders are
specifically designed forprecise
suturing, thereby facilitating the
surgeon's task.•Carb-N-Sert jawsarecustom
styled withteeth ranging from2600
p.sq. inchto16000 p.sq. inch,
according tothesizeoftheinstru-
ment andthesizes ofneedles and
sutures used. Some needle holder
patterns arealsoavailable with
smooth Carb-N-Sert jaws, de-
signed toholdthesmallest sutures
inmicro-surgical andplastic
surgery procedures.
•Theedges around theoutside of
thejawsarechamfered toprevent

_Ophthalmic Instruments 1111 ••••••
SCHIOTZ TONOMETERS
Allunitsareconstructed withjewelled hammers tominimize friction. Auto-
clavable. Scale markings areetched foraccuracy. Scales areinclined,
permitting reading fromabove.
Each unitsupplied withcertification tomeet specification established bythe
Committee onStandardization ofTonometers oftheA.A.O.O. Individually
packaged infittedcasewithweights andtestblock.
18·132 Original Model, with3weights (5.5gr.,7.5gr.and10gr.)Plunger, Footplate
andTestBlock arestainless steel; remainder made ofrustless materials
18·132A Same asNo.18-132, butwithAllen Plunger Retractor'
18·134 Improved Model, with4weights (5.5gr.,7.5gr.,10gr.andt5gr.),mirror
insert onscale reduces errorofparallax; entirely made ofstainless steel.
18·134A Same asNo.134,butwithAllen Plunger Retractor'
18·139 Sterilizing Case forSchiotz Tonometers 6V2"(16.5 em)x3V2"(8.9em)x
1%"(3.2em)fitted tofirmly holdtonometer, \'Ieights andtestblock
'With theAllen Plunger Retractor, theplunger isheldinretracted
position, flushwiththesurlace ofthefootplate untiltonometer isin
place oncornea. Thisfeature willprevent anypossible damage to
cornea tissue.

ii
877-468-5572 USA        800-275-7192 fax        integralife.com Introduction    n   Ordering and Warranty
Pricing:
Prices stated in specific written quotations are firm for thirty 
days from the date given, and are otherwise subject to change without prior notice. Pricing terms stated on written agreements are governed by such agreements.
Shipments:
F.O.B. Integra LifeSciences point of shipment within the continental United States. Shipping costs (including freight and insurance), shall be prepaid by Integra LifeSciences and invoiced to customers.
Ordering Procedure:
A written purchase order on customer’s form may be requested for purchases of Integra LifeSciences products.
Acceptance of Orders:
Orders are accepted upon approval by Integra LifeSciences.Return Policy:
• Authorization, from customer service, must be obtained  prior to returning product within 90 days of receipt of   
 product.
• Sterile product must be returned in unopened, undamaged              
 cartons, packed to prevent damage. 
• Non-sterile product must be returned in unused saleable      
 condition in original package.
• Credit will be issued for goods returned prior to ninety 
 days from ship date with a 20% restocking charge. This 
 assumes that the product returned is not damaged and 
 can be verified to have not been used or opened.
For Product Instructions for Use, please visit  integralife.com/jarit
Integra Standard Warranty
INTEGRA LIFESCIENCES CORPORATION ("INTEGRA") warrants to the original purchaser only that each new INTEGRA product is free from manufacturing defects in material and workmanship under normal use and service for a period of two (2) years (except as otherwise expressly provided as to accessory items) from the date of delivery by INTEGRA to the first purchaser, but in no event beyond the expiration date stated on any product labeling.
Surgical instruments are guaranteed to be free from defects in material and workmanship when maintained and cleaned 
properly and used normally for their intended purpose.
Any covered product that is placed by INTEGRA under a lease, rental or installment purchase agreement and that requires 
repair service during the term of such placement agreement shall be repaired in accordance with the terms of such agreement.
If any covered defect occurs during the warranty period or term of such placement agreement, the purchaser should 
communicate directly with INTEGRA ’s home office. If purchaser seeks to invoke the terms of this warranty, the product must be returned to INTEGRA at its home office. The defective product should be returned promptly, properly packaged and 
postage prepaid. Loss or damage in return shipment to INTEGRA shall be at CUSTOMER’s risk. INTEGRA's sole responsibility 
under this warranty shall be repair or replacement, at INTEGRA ’s sole discretion at INTEGRA ’s expense, subject to the terms of this warranty and applicable agreements IN NO EVENT SHALL INTEGRA BE LIABLE FOR ANY INCIDENTAL, INDIRECT , CONSEQUENTIAL OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES IN CONNECTION WITH THE ACQUISITION OR USE OF ANY INTEGRA PRODUCT . Further, this warranty shall not apply to, and INTEGRA shall not be responsible for, any loss arising in connection with the purchase or use of any INTEGRA product that has been repaired by anyone other than an authorized INTEGRA service representative or altered in any way so as, in INTEGRA ’s judgment, to affect its stability or reliability, or which has been subject to misuse, negligence or accident, or which has been used otherwise than in accordance with the instructions furnished by INTEGRA. RB5863DT
The Ultra-Coat™ Kerrison rongeurs have an extremely hard material coating that increases the surface hardness                                             
vs regular stainless steel kerrison rongeurs, extending the life of the cutting edge.
• Coating greatly reduces the frequency of sharpening and lowers replacement costs
• The surface smoothness enhances the sliding action
• Features a unique thin footplate design that facilitates easy insertion, without compromising tip strength

Integra ® MicroFrance ®  n   Warranty
Warranty  Information
1Warranty
A.  This LIMITED W ARRANTY provides assurance for the customer who purchases an Integra Product (hereinafter the “Product”) that should  
the Product fail to function to Integra’s published specifications during the term of this LIMITED WARRANTY (one year from the date of  
shipment for new Product), that Integra will at its option either replace, repair, or issue a credit (adjusted to reflect the age of the Product) 
for the Product or any portion thereof. This LIMITED WARRANTY is extended only to the buyer purchasing the Product directly from Integra or from its affiliate or its authorized distributor or representative.
B. 
            
T o qualify for this LIMITED WARRANTY , the following conditions must be met:
    (1) The Product must be used on or before its “Use By” or “Use Before” date, if applicable.
    (2) The Product must be used in accordance with its labeling and may not be altered or subjected to misuse, abuse, accident  
          or improper handling.
    (3) Integra must be notified in writing within thirty (30) days following discovery of a defect.    (4) The Product must be returned to Integra within thirty (30) days of Integra receiving notice as provided for in (3) above.    (5) Upon examination of the Product by Integra, Integra shall have determined that: (i) the Product was not repaired or altered by anyone                                      
          other than Integra or its authorized representative, (ii) the Product was not operated under conditions other than normal use, and (iii)  
          the prescribed periodic maintenance and services have been performed on the Product.
C. 
 This LIMITED W
ARRANTY is limited to its express terms. THIS LIMITED WARRANTY IS IN LIEU OF ALL OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESSED          
OR IMPLIED WHETHER STATUTORY OR OTHERWISE, INCLUDING ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A              
PARTICULAR PURPOSE. In no event shall Integra be liable for any consequential, incidental, prospective or other similar damage resulting  from a defect, failure, or malfunction of the Product, whether a claim for such damage is based upon the warranty, contract, negligence or      otherwise.
D. 
 The ex
clusions and limitations set out above are not intended to, and should not be construed so as to, contravene mandatory provisions  
of applicable law. Users may benefit from statutory warranty rights under legislation governing the sale of consumer goods. If any part or  term of this LIMITED WARRANTY is held by any court of competent jurisdiction to be illegal, unenforceable, or in conflict with applicable law, the validity of the remaining portion of the LIMITED WARRANTY shall not be affected, and all rights and obligations shall be construed and enforced as if this LIMITED WARRANTY did not contain the particular part or term held to be invalid.
Ordering Procedure
A written purchase order on customer’s form may be requested for purchase of Integra products.
Acceptance of Order
Orders are accepted upon approval by Integra.
Returned Goods Policy
Products must be returned in unopened packages with manufacturer’s seals intact to be accepted for replacement or credit unless returned 
due to a complaint of product defect. Determination of a product defect will be made by Integra. Products will not be accepted for replace -
ment if they have been in the possession of the customer for more than 90 days. 
Repairs and Maintenance
Should your instruments require repair or maintenance, contact Integra for return authorization and address. Instruments returned to Integra for repair must have a statement testifying that each instrument has been thoroughly cleaned and sterilized. Failure to supply evidence of cleaning and disinfection will result in a cleaning charge and delayed processing of your instrument repair.USA 800-654-2873        888-980-7742 fax        International +1 609-936-5400        1 609-750-4259 fax        integralife.com/contact

of mouth, and fragile gum mucosa from incidental traumaLonger lateral loop helps improve handpiece maneuverability

3717012Henry Endoscopic Parathyroid Instrument Set
The Henry instruments were designed for the minimally 
invasive endoscopic lateral approach to parathyroid surgery.  
The set includes a series of insulated monopolar instruments  
to provide hemostasis to the operative site. The 3mm trocars  provide operating ports for the instrumentation and can be sutured to prevent involuntary removal. The 10mm trocar ring has been specifically designed to maintain insufflation and traction during surgery. 
Developed in conjunction with Jean-François Henry, MD
Catalog # Description
MCLP00** Henry Endoscopic Parathyroid Instrument Set
Set consist of the following;

CP391 Monopolar Cable, 185cm (72.8")Abitbol Laser Microlaryngeal Instruments
These refined instruments help reduce many of the complications 
associated with laser surgery of the larynx. The set of grasping  forceps is insulated and may help minimize the possibility  of laser-related injuries. The forceps has integrated suction for evacuation of the laser plume, and features monopolar jaws to allow hemostasis in the areas of the larynx that are difficult to address.
Developed in conjunction with Jean Abitbol, MD

Sataloff Laryngoscopes
The Sataloff Laryngoscopes have a large proximal opening for binocular  
microscope vision. They offer dual light fibers and dual suction for maximum  illumination and visualization during microsurgery. The elevated triangular tips have been blunted that may help reduce tissue trauma.
The anterior commissure laryngoscopes (MCL120, MCL121, MCL122, and MCL123) 
have been designed to help provide the ability to examine the vocal cords at the  anterior commissure. In addition, the MCL125 anterior commissure laryngoscope was designed for patients with limited laryngeal exposure. 
The Vallecula Laryngoscope (MCL124) has a wide proximal opening and a  
high blunted lift on the distal tip.
All laryngoscopes can be used with the MicroFrance suspension  
apparatus (MCL76) and chest plate (MCL35).

USA 800-654-2873        888-980-7742 fax        International +1 609-936-5400        1 609-750-4259 fax        integralife.com/contactSataloff Indirect Laryngeal Instrument Set
The Sataloff Indirect Laryngeal Instrument Set is used for office-based  
procedures. This set includes dilators, cupped forceps, scissors,  heart-shaped forceps, alligator forceps, and suctions that are curved  to help facilitate access to the laryngeal region with the patient in a  sitting position. The smaller instrument tray has been designed for  use with office-oriented sterilization equipment.
Developed in conjunction with Robert T . Sataloff, MD, DMA, FACS

Laryngeal Bipolar Forceps
The Laryngeal Bipolar Forceps are designed for  
laryngology and phonomicrosurgery procedures. 
The coagulating tip is 5mm in length, and the design  
helps ensure that the bipolar energy is delivered in a  controlled manner. The 29cm length and the 3mm  outer diameter make these forceps useful for delicate  work. A specially designed stainless steel instrument  tray is also included.

37170253717026
Kraus TM MicroCut® Forceps
 
The Kraus TM MicroCut® Forceps were designed to  help remove the epithelial edge of a tympanic  membrane perforation without over-enlarging the  existing perforation. 
Useful during tympanic membrane patching,  
myringoplasty, and tympanoplasty procedures
Designed for precision edge cuttingLow profile rotation knob allows for universal 360°  
cutting ability and promotes visualization
Thumb-activated reverse-action handle allows for  
controlled movement and helps reduce distal tip motion
Distal tip basket captures resected tissue to help prevent  
tissue from entering the middle ear
Developed in conjunction with Eric M. Kraus, MD, MS, FACS

MCEN150** Duncavage Sphenoid Sinus Set
3717002
MCEN151
 MCEN152
MCEN155
 MCEN156
MCEN153
 MCEN154
MCEN157
 MCEN158Duncavage Sphenoid Sinus Instrument Set
The Duncavage Sphenoid Sinus Set was developed to  
allow access to the interior of the sphenoid sinus. These  instruments help surgeons remove cysts and bone, as well as  strip mucosa and palpate masses within the sphenoid sinus.  All of the Duncavage instruments feature a 25º bend superiorly  and a 25º bend inferiorly at the distal tips that allow the  surgeon to help access the sphenoid sinus. They also feature  reverse-action handles that help reduce the amount of  movement at the distal tips when actuated.
Developed in conjunction with James A. Duncavage, MDSinus Instrumentation

MCSK0** Kennedy Frontal Sinus Surgery Instrument SetKennedy Frontal Sinus Instrument Set
This set of malleable instruments has been designed to aid in

**Not for sale outside USINCHES
MILLIMETERS1012345678910
2030405060708090100110120130140150160170180190200210220230240250
340
USA 800-654-2873        888-980-7742 fax        International +1 609-936-5400        1 609-750-4259 fax        integralife.com/contactLevine Orbital Decompression Instrument Set
The Levine Orbital Decompression Instrument Set is suited for  
intranasal endoscopic orbital decompression. The Levine Perforator is designed to create the initial opening through the medial orbital wall  (lamina papyracea). The 15 degree angled suction curettes and picks  are designed to help gently remove the lamina. The angled sickle  knife incises the periorbita to liberate the orbital fat. The serrated  jaws of the angled forceps do not completely close, allowing for a firm,  yet atraumatic grip to assist in teasing the orbital fat into the sinus  cavity. The 10-instrument set is provided with an instrument tray.
Developed in conjunction with Howard L. Levine, MD

MCEN136
MCEN136SCWormald Frontal Sinus Surgery Instrument Set
This malleable set of instruments has been designed to aid in  
preservation of mucosa within the frontal recess and frontal sinus. The set includes five instruments and an instrument tray.  Each instrument has a working length of 11cm with an outer  diameter ranging from 2.0mm to 2.5mm. The last 4cm of each  instrument is malleable for access across a wide range of  anatomies. A variable suction design on the malleable suction  probe, freer suction elevator, and sharp-cupped suction  curette allows the surgeon to control the amount of suction  through a thumb-controlled aperture.
Developed in conjunction with P . J. Wormald, MD, FRACS, FRCS

MCEN27
MCEN27-3
Backbiting Forceps
Available in four sizes, the MicroFrance® Backbiting Forceps 
provide an outstanding cutting edge, thin shaft, and strong  cutting capability while working in the nasal cavity. T rying to  use a shaver on the uncinate process can be difficult, so these  specialized backbiters allow a reverse approach when removing  or making an opening in the uncinate process during sinus surgery.
They also provide a better alternative to traditional backbiting 
forceps because of their unique downward sloping shaft. The slim profile and tapered shaft design of these forceps fit ideally into the middle meatus to aid in reducing trauma to the middle turbinates during surgery. MCEN27-3 features a distinctive gentle upward curved shaft for accessing difficult-to-reach areas of the sinus.
Backbiting Forceps, Rotatable
Working length 80mm (3⅛")
Catalog # Description

MCEN67-2MCEN67
MCEN67-1MCEN66MCEN65MCEN66Mini-Struycken Through-Cutting Forceps
These through-cutting forceps with a slim profile assist in  
accessing the frontal recess and frontal sinus to help remove  cell walls and bony partitions. The forceps are designed in  both side-to-side and front-to-back biting configurations  with 90 and 45 degree bends. They are also designed with  rectangular jaws in the dimensions of 3.0mm wide with a  1.5mm wide bite.

**Not for sale outside USWormald Bipolar Forceps with Suction
Available in two lengths, the Wormald Bipolar Forceps with Suction help 
achieve hemostasis during endoscopic sinus and anterior skull base surgery. The longer forceps are able to reach the pituitary. Both feature a slim profile  and fine tips to help provide access within difficult-to-reach areas. The  integrated suction can be advanced independently of the cautery tips to help provide visibility of the operative site, and then retracted from the line of sight during cauterization. An integrated flush port facilitates cleaning and debris removal.
Developed in conjunction with P . J. Wormald, MD, FRACS, FRCS

Legent Flexible T ension Arm
The MicroFrance® Legent Flexible T ension Arm can be used for a  
variety of procedures including otology, neurotology, and sinus  procedures. The flexible arm attaches to the operating room table  and holds a variety of instrumentation so that both hands can be  free for operation. Included with the flexible arm are the ear speculum forceps, malleable retractor blade, and nasal speculum connection. An adjustable endoscope holder is also available to support a rigid telescope. The angulated ball joint can be used with any of the attachments to facilitate positioning of the instrument  during surgery.

MCO982 Nasal Speculum Connection
